hackathon-eligibility: All previously registered and RSVPd students can take part.
hackathon-requirements:
- YOU MUST BE REGISTERED FOR HACKDAVIS TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOR SUBMISSION
- You cannot work on your project before hacking begins (which is officially 12:00pm PT on Saturday, May 7th) 
- You must submit your project by 12:00 PT on Sunday, May 8th
- You cannot steal another team's source code
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Nexus Players + Parrot Mini Drones for each team member
Apple iPad Mini 2s for each team member
GoPro Heroes for each team member
Summer internships at New Story Inc + 1 year of GitHub Silver
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Health & Wellness Nonprofit Hack - Sponsored by New Story Inc

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Summer internships at Teach for America + 1 year of GitHub Silver
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Education Nonprofit Hack - Sponsored by Teach For America

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1300 to the winning team for best use of touch hardware using Synaptics hardware / software.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Touch Hardware - Sponsored by Synaptics

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1300 to the winning team for best use of fingerprint hardware using Synaptics hardware / software.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Fingerprint Hardware - Sponsored by Synaptics

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=The ARC- Activities and Recreation Center, 232 Shields Ave, Davis, CA 95616, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Hacks that are more difficult to implement will be scored highly. Impressive architecture, technical difficulty, and solving hard problems are all important parts of a successful hack. Using more advanced technologies is also a plus.

We want HackDavis to be an environment that encourages highly innovative and different ideas, so we will be keeping an eye out for ideas that pique our interest or make us see the space or problem differently.
HackDavis is a hackathon about social good. The hacks that most benefit our nonprofits, make a positive impact on the local community, and benefit humanity as a whole will score some major points.

hackathon-location-address: The ARC- Activities and Recreation Center, 232 Shields Ave, Davis, CA 95616, USA
hackathon-description-header: UC Davis's first major collegiate hackathon dedicated to social good.
hackathon-location-description: University of California, Davis -- ARC Ballrooms
